meanings.definition: To break down or decompose by the action of light.
meanings.sent1: Leaves can photolyze under the sun's rays.
meanings.sent2: The plastic bottle started to photolyze when left outside.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate bar seemed to photolyze into a gooey mess under the hot lamp.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams began to photolyze like mist in the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The ice sculpture photolyzed into a puddle as the day warmed up.

meanings.definition: To undergo decomposition by the action of light.
meanings.sent1: The paper easily photolyzes when exposed to direct sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Certain chemicals can photolyze when placed under UV light.
meanings.sent3: The old painting appeared to photolyze into faded colors under the bright gallery lights.
meanings.sent4: His confidence seemed to photolyze under the intense scrutiny of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The ancient parchment photolyzed into dust when brought out into the daylight.
